text: Fenua Tamuera is a former I-Kiribati politician. She served as a Member of Parliament for Butaritari, during the fourth Parliament of Kiribati. She was the second woman to be elected to the House of Assembly, after Tekarei Russell in 1974.Van Trease 1993, p. 356. Originally from Tuvalu, Tamuera qualified with a General Nursing and Obstetric Nursing Certificate from the Fiji School of Nursing in 1967.Van Trease 1993, p. 375. She was elected to the House of Assembly after the death of her husband, Tamuera Taniera, triggered a by- election in 1990, but she lost her seat in the subsequent 1991 Kiribati parliamentary election. ==References== ==Bibliography== * Category:Living people Category:Members of the House of Assembly of Kiribati Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:20th- century I-Kiribati politicians Category:20th-century I-Kiribati women politicians Category:Tuvaluan emigrants to Kiribati
title: Fenua Tamuera
